contextId.information: These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that believers should not be afraid of those who persecute them. AT: "Do not be afraid of what people might do to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Do not fear what they fear. Do not be troubled

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. Peter uses them to emphasize the need to think clearly about life since the end of the world is near. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: be of sound mind, and be sober in your thinking
